db:abstract.db:para: The QDomDocumentFragment class is a tree of QDomNodes which is not usually a complete QDomDocument.

db:note.db:para: All functions in this class are reentrant.

db:listitem.db:para: QDomDocumentFragment is part of XML Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: If you want to do complex tree operations it is useful to have a lightweight class to store nodes and their relations. QDomDocumentFragment stores a subtree of a document which does not necessarily represent a well-formed XML document.

QDomDocumentFragment is also useful if you want to group several nodes in a list and insert them all together as children of some node. In these cases QDomDocumentFragment can be used as a temporary container for this list of children.

The most important feature of QDomDocumentFragment is that it is treated in a special way by QDomNode::insertAfter(), QDomNode::insertBefore(), QDomNode::replaceChild() and QDomNode::appendChild(): instead of inserting the fragment itself, all the fragment's children are inserted.

db:section.db:title: QDomDocumentFragment::QDomDocumentFragment(const QDomDocumentFragment &x)
db:section.db:para: The data of the copy is shared (shallow copy): modifying one node will also change the other. If you want to make a deep copy, use cloneNode().

db:section.db:title: QDomDocumentFragment &QDomDocumentFragment::operator=(const QDomDocumentFragment &x)
db:section.db:para: Assigns x to this DOM document fragment.
The data of the copy is shared (shallow copy): modifying one node will also change the other. If you want to make a deep copy, use cloneNode().
